title: Deep-JGAC: End-to-End Deep Joint Geometry and Attribute Compression for Dense Colored Point Clouds
author: Yun Zhang (Shenzhen Institutes of Advanced Technology), Zixi Guo (Sun Yat-Sen University), Linwei Zhu (Shenzhen Institutes of Advanced Technology), C.-C. Jay Kuo (University of Southern California), ...
relevance_why: The proposed compression methods can be adapted for audio and visual data, potentially informing approaches in audio processing with joint feature representation.
background: This work focuses on compressing colored point clouds, aiming to reduce data size while preserving important geometric and attribute information.
contribution: This paper introduces a novel framework for joint geometry and attribute compression of point clouds, achieving significant reductions in bit rate compared to existing methods.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods like G-PCC and V-PCC compress geometry and attributes separately, which may overlook the correlation between them.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by utilizing an attribute-assisted geometry encoding and optimized re-colorization to leverage geometric and attribute correlations for better compression.

key_innovation: The integration of geometry and attribute encoding with collaborative feature extraction allows the model to achieve higher efficiency in compression.
real_world_impact: This framework enhances the storage and transmission efficiency of dense 3D point clouds, which has implications for applications in autonomous systems and virtual reality.
limitations: The efficiency may drop in certain datasets due to inconsistent distributions between training and test data.

new_terms.Point Cloud Compression: **Point Cloud Compression** refers to methods for reducing the amount of data required to represent a 3D point cloud while preserving its important features.
new_terms.Attribute Information Fusion Module: **Attribute Information Fusion Module** is a component that integrates attribute data into geometry encoding to improve feature extraction by exploiting their interdependence.
